events.description: Street food event organized by MITeri, where we brought the exquisite taste of Nepali street foods to the doors of MIT, satisfying the desire of over 300 curious students and staff! Chatpate, pani puri, momos, samosas, sel roti, and dhungri were among the highlights of the event! And, of course, any Nepali event is incomplete without dancing to pleasant Nepali songs that bring back the memories of Nepal!

Dashain Dinner with Dr. Lochan Rijal, students and alumni of MIT, Harvard, Tufts, Wellesley, BU, Brandeis, and more! MITeri and Harvard Nepali students organize a Dashain dinner and get together with students from around Boston every year.

Rijal’s MIT artist residency included collaborations with the MIT Nepal Initiative and MIT Arts. MIT’s Nepali student association. Rijal’s residency activities on campus culminated in काँचो आवाज (Raw Sounds), a public concert of Nepali music featuring original compositions played on traditional Nepali instruments.
MITeri hanging out with Rafael Reif, the president of MIT. MITeri participated in an annual international Culture Fest, where we represented Nepal and showed Nepali culture.

Our friends at Harvard hosted a discussion with Mr. Gagan Thapa, a current member of the House of Representatives representing Kathmandu-4 and former minister of Health and Population. Mr. Thapa was attending a 2-week long program at Harvard Kennedy School.
MITeri organizes a Momo (Nepali Dumplings) event where members make Momos and talk about Nepali culture.
